content:
Hi, I'm trying to use mathlib at a specific commit (a long time ago), however the proofwidgets dependency happens to be broken over a range of commits that prevents the update from completing.

When I do lake update mathlib, I get this error (which is not important):
error: ./.lake/packages/proofwidgets/lakefile.lean:6:2: error: 'buildArchive' is not a field of structure 'Lake.PackageConfig'

My plan was to pass a flag to lake somehow
lake update mathlib -- --skip proof-widgets

Or, maybe there is something I can drop into the lakefile?
require mathlib from git "https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4" @ s!"3752900e2f1" --skip proof-widgets

if there isn't a way to do this, then no worries, I'll try something else.

No, I don't think there's anything like that. But really proof widgets should not be broken if you get the right version. Have you made sure to update the lean-toolchain file to match the one in mathlib at the commit you want?

Thanks! I thought that lake update mathlib was overwriting my lean-toolchain automatically to match the mathlib version.

Looks like I'll need to ensure they match by $ cp ./lake/path-to/mathlib/lean-toolchain .
Derek Rhodes has marked this topic as resolved.
